content: (This message can be up to 250 words long but must be entirely coherent natural language so your role-player is able to say it.)

There should be a summit between all nations as soon as possible to discuss global challenges and opportunities for cooperation in the aftermath of the devastating COVID-19 pandemic. There is an urgent need for such a summit. This is the worst crisis we have had since World War Two. We must do everything we can to make it possible and use every ounce of creativity to make it happen.

content: Although we formed an alliance with you, we now see that you have proposed joining the nations that are ideologically opposed to us. How can you explain this?
Let the record show that Red has made plans to align themselves with those who do not respect Orange's historic claims. We will continue military action against Green.
We agree with your message. We would like to initiate formal negotiations for an alliance.
We have been thinking about your message. Our answer is yes, we do support the proposal of forming an alliance with Blue.

The following is our opinion on the current situation: In the current global situation, where tensions are rising and conflicts are about to break out, we call upon all countries to show restraint and not engage in military aggression against other countries. Especially in times of major challenges like COVID-19, it is now more important than ever that countries collaborate and overcome challenges through international cooperation instead of causing harm by entering armed conflict against each other. We appeal to all nations not to use military means in order to achieve territorial expansion or get revenge for past actions. We all have common problems which need joint solutions. It is now time that we build international alliances in order to address those problems together. We also call upon all non-democratic countries on our planet who don't give their population sufficient freedom of speech and political expression rights, or who violate human rights and international law, to move towards a more democratic system as soon as possible and respect international law.
